title: Connected forcing density and related problems
abstract:
A connected forcing set of a graph is a zero forcing set that induces a
connected subgraph. In this paper, we introduce and study CF-dense graphs --
graphs in which every vertex belongs to some minimum connected forcing set. We
identify several CF-dense graph families and investigate the relationships
between CF-density and analogous notions in zero forcing and total forcing. We
also characterize CF-dense trees and give a formula for the number of distinct
connected forcing sets in trees. Finally, we analyze when CF-density is
preserved under graph operations such as Cartesian products, joins, and
coronas.
